title: Welcome to my website!

Welcome to my website!
I am Victor Pastrana-Gómez, a current student in the Medical Scientist Training Program at Case Western Reserve University.
My current research includes ultrasound imaging and the use of lipid based nanobubbles as contrast for use within ultrasound imaging. My project specifically includes looking at the transit of these nanobubbles and analyzing their movement in order to predict drug distribution and potential efficacy of chemotherapeutics when looking at tumor models in mice.
In addition to my research, I entertain myself with various hobbies. I enjoy cooking new meals, hiking, running and playing/watching football (soccer). As you explore my website, I am sure you will see examples of all of these things!

My Github Page!

title: Projects
text: Nanobubbles are lipid shell based nanoparticles that are able to expand and contract in response to an acoustic field. The field, in this case, comes from the ultrasound transducer. Due to their special movements, they are bright and able to be seen on ultrasound images. Their small size does not allow for individual observation, but together they act as an echogenic fluid! This way we hope to gain more insight into the structures of tumors and the potential efficacy of different chemotherapeutics.

title: Projects
text:
Mini Organs in a Dish

During my time working at Cincinnati Children’s Hospital, my main project involved using patient derived induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) to develop vascularized organoids. This way we can recreate the same processes that occur in development, but in a dish!

title: Photography
text:
As a wizard and scholar of Middle-earth, I have been studying the magic of the natural world for centuries. Through my self-portraits, I aim to capture the essence of my own being and reflect on my own journey through time. Each photograph is a reflection of my own experiences and emotions. Through my photography, I hope to offer a glimpse into my life as a scholar and adventurer, and inspire others to reflect on their own journeys through the world.
